00042 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00043 
00044 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00045 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00046 
00047 #define CFS_WS_NAME_LEN         16
00048 
00049 struct cfs_wi_sched {
00050         struct list_head                ws_list;        /* chain on global list */
00052         spinlock_t                      ws_lock;
00054         wait_queue_head_t               ws_waitq;
00056         struct list_head                ws_runq;
00062         struct list_head                ws_rerunq;
00064         struct cfs_cpt_table    *ws_cptab;
00066         int                     ws_cpt;
00068         int                     ws_nscheduled;
00070         unsigned int            ws_nthreads:30;
00072         unsigned int            ws_stopping:1;
00074         unsigned int            ws_starting:1;
00076         char                    ws_name[CFS_WS_NAME_LEN];
00077 };
00078 
00079 static struct cfs_workitem_data {
00081         spinlock_t              wi_glock;
00083         struct list_head        wi_scheds;
00085         int                     wi_init;
00087         int                     wi_stopping;
00088 } cfs_wi_data;
00089 
00090 static inline int
00091 cfs_wi_sched_cansleep(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched)
00092 {
00093         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00094         if (sched->ws_stopping) {
00095                 spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00096                 return 0;
00097         }
00098 
00099         if (!list_empty(&sched->ws_runq)) {
00100                 spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00101                 return 0;
00102         }
00103         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00104         return 1;
00105 }
00106 
00107 /* XXX:
00108  * 0. it only works when called from wi->wi_action.
00109  * 1. when it returns no one shall try to schedule the workitem.
00110  */
00111 void
00112 cfs_wi_exit(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi)
00113 {
00114         LASSERT(!in_interrupt()); /* because we use plain spinlock */
00115         LASSERT(!sched->ws_stopping);
00116 
00117         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00118 
00119         LASSERT(wi->wi_running);
00120 
00121         if (wi->wi_scheduled) { /* cancel pending schedules */
00122                 LASSERT(!list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00123                 list_del_init(&wi->wi_list);
00124 
00125                 LASSERT(sched->ws_nscheduled > 0);
00126                 sched->ws_nscheduled--;
00127         }
00128 
00129         LASSERT(list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00130 
00131         wi->wi_scheduled = 1; /* LBUG future schedule attempts */
00132         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00133 
00134         return;
00135 }
00136 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_wi_exit);
00137 
00141 int
00142 cfs_wi_deschedule(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi)
00143 {
00144         int     rc;
00145 
00146         LASSERT(!in_interrupt()); /* because we use plain spinlock */
00147         LASSERT(!sched->ws_stopping);
00148 
00149         /*
00150          * return 0 if it's running already, otherwise return 1, which
00151          * means the workitem will not be scheduled and will not have
00152          * any race with wi_action.
00153          */
00154         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00155 
00156         rc = !(wi->wi_running);
00157 
00158         if (wi->wi_scheduled) { /* cancel pending schedules */
00159                 LASSERT(!list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00160                 list_del_init(&wi->wi_list);
00161 
00162                 LASSERT(sched->ws_nscheduled > 0);
00163                 sched->ws_nscheduled--;
00164 
00165                 wi->wi_scheduled = 0;
00166         }
00167 
00168         LASSERT (list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00169 
00170         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00171         return rc;
00172 }
00173 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_wi_deschedule);
00174 
00175 /*
00176  * Workitem scheduled with (serial == 1) is strictly serialised not only with
00177  * itself, but also with others scheduled this way.
00178  *
00179  * Now there's only one static serialised queue, but in the future more might
00180  * be added, and even dynamic creation of serialised queues might be supported.
00181  */
00182 void
00183 cfs_wi_schedule(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched, struct cfs_workitem *wi)
00184 {
00185         LASSERT(!in_interrupt()); /* because we use plain spinlock */
00186         LASSERT(!sched->ws_stopping);
00187 
00188         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00189 
00190         if (!wi->wi_scheduled) {
00191                 LASSERT (list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00192 
00193                 wi->wi_scheduled = 1;
00194                 sched->ws_nscheduled++;
00195                 if (!wi->wi_running) {
00196                         list_add_tail(&wi->wi_list, &sched->ws_runq);
00197                         wake_up(&sched->ws_waitq);
00198                 } else {
00199                         list_add(&wi->wi_list, &sched->ws_rerunq);
00200                 }
00201         }
00202 
00203         LASSERT (!list_empty(&wi->wi_list));
00204         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00205         return;
00206 }
00207 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_wi_schedule);
00208 
00209 static int
00210 cfs_wi_scheduler(void *arg)
00211 {
00212         struct cfs_wi_sched *sched = (struct cfs_wi_sched *)arg;
00213 
00214         cfs_block_allsigs();
00215 
00216         /* CPT affinity scheduler? */
00217         if (sched->ws_cptab != NULL)
00218                 if (cfs_cpt_bind(sched->ws_cptab, sched->ws_cpt) != 0)
00219                         CWARN("Failed to bind %s on CPT %d\n",
00220                                 sched->ws_name, sched->ws_cpt);
00221 
00222         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00223 
00224         LASSERT(sched->ws_starting == 1);
00225         sched->ws_starting--;
00226         sched->ws_nthreads++;
00227 
00228         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00229 
00230         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00231 
00232         while (!sched->ws_stopping) {
00233                 int             nloops = 0;
00234                 int             rc;
00235                 struct cfs_workitem *wi;
00236 
00237                 while (!list_empty(&sched->ws_runq) &&
00238                        nloops < CFS_WI_RESCHED) {
00239                         wi = list_entry(sched->ws_runq.next,
00240                                         struct cfs_workitem, wi_list);
00241                         LASSERT(wi->wi_scheduled && !wi->wi_running);
00242 
00243                         list_del_init(&wi->wi_list);
00244 
00245                         LASSERT(sched->ws_nscheduled > 0);
00246                         sched->ws_nscheduled--;
00247 
00248                         wi->wi_running   = 1;
00249                         wi->wi_scheduled = 0;
00250 
00251                         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00252                         nloops++;
00253 
00254                         rc = (*wi->wi_action) (wi);
00255 
00256                         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00257                         if (rc != 0) /* WI should be dead, even be freed! */
00258                                 continue;
00259 
00260                         wi->wi_running = 0;
00261                         if (list_empty(&wi->wi_list))
00262                                 continue;
00263 
00264                         LASSERT(wi->wi_scheduled);
00265                         /* wi is rescheduled, should be on rerunq now, we
00266                          * move it to runq so it can run action now */
00267                         list_move_tail(&wi->wi_list, &sched->ws_runq);
00268                 }
00269 
00270                 if (!list_empty(&sched->ws_runq)) {
00271                         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00272                         /* don't sleep because some workitems still
00273                          * expect me to come back soon */
00274                         cond_resched();
00275                         spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00276                         continue;
00277                 }
00278 
00279                 spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00280                 rc = wait_event_interruptible_exclusive(sched->ws_waitq,
00281                                 !cfs_wi_sched_cansleep(sched));
00282                 spin_lock(&sched->ws_lock);
00283         }
00284 
00285         spin_unlock(&sched->ws_lock);
00286 
00287         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00288         sched->ws_nthreads--;
00289         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00290 
00291         return 0;
00292 }
00293 
00294 void
00295 cfs_wi_sched_destroy(struct cfs_wi_sched *sched)
00296 {
00297         LASSERT(cfs_wi_data.wi_init);
00298         LASSERT(!cfs_wi_data.wi_stopping);
00299 
00300         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00301         if (sched->ws_stopping) {
00302                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s is in progress of stopping\n",
00303                        sched->ws_name);
00304                 spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00305                 return;
00306         }
00307 
00308         LASSERT(!list_empty(&sched->ws_list));
00309         sched->ws_stopping = 1;
00310 
00311         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00312 
00313         wake_up_all(&sched->ws_waitq);
00314 
00315         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00316         {
00317                 int i = 2;
00318 
00319                 while (sched->ws_nthreads > 0) {
00320                         CDEBUG(IS_PO2(++i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
00321                                "waiting for %d threads of WI sched[%s] to "
00322                                "terminate\n", sched->ws_nthreads,
00323                                sched->ws_name);
00324 
00325                         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00326                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00327                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1) / 20);
00328                         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00329                 }
00330         }
00331 
00332         list_del(&sched->ws_list);
00333 
00334         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00335 
00336         LASSERT(sched->ws_nscheduled == 0);
00337 
00338         LIBCFS_FREE(sched, sizeof(*sched));
00339 }
00340 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_wi_sched_destroy);
00341 
00342 int
00343 cfs_wi_sched_create(char *name, struct cfs_cpt_table *cptab,
00344                     int cpt, int nthrs, struct cfs_wi_sched **sched_pp)
00345 {
00346         struct cfs_wi_sched     *sched;
00347 
00348         LASSERT(cfs_wi_data.wi_init);
00349         LASSERT(!cfs_wi_data.wi_stopping);
00350         LASSERT(cptab == NULL || cpt == CFS_CPT_ANY ||
00351                 (cpt >= 0 && cpt < cfs_cpt_number(cptab)));
00352 
00353         LIBCFS_ALLOC(sched, sizeof(*sched));
00354         if (sched == NULL)
00355                 return -ENOMEM;
00356 
00357         if (strlen(name) > sizeof(sched->ws_name)-1) {
00358                 LIBCFS_FREE(sched, sizeof(*sched));
00359                 return -E2BIG;
00360         }
00361         strlcpy(sched->ws_name, name, sizeof(sched->ws_name));
00362 
00363         sched->ws_cptab = cptab;
00364         sched->ws_cpt = cpt;
00365 
00366         spin_lock_init(&sched->ws_lock);
00367         init_waitqueue_head(&sched->ws_waitq);
00368 
00369         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->ws_runq);
00370         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->ws_rerunq);
00371         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->ws_list);
00372 
00373         for (; nthrs > 0; nthrs--)  {
00374                 char                    name[16];
00375                 struct task_struct      *task;
00376 
00377                 spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00378                 while (sched->ws_starting > 0) {
00379                         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00380                         schedule();
00381                         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00382                 }
00383 
00384                 sched->ws_starting++;
00385                 spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00386 
00387                 if (sched->ws_cptab != NULL && sched->ws_cpt >= 0) {
00388                         snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%s_%02d_%02d",
00389                                  sched->ws_name, sched->ws_cpt,
00390                                  sched->ws_nthreads);
00391                 } else {
00392                         snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%s_%02d",
00393                                  sched->ws_name, sched->ws_nthreads);
00394                 }
00395 
00396                 task = kthread_run(cfs_wi_scheduler, sched, name);
00397                 if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00398                         int rc = PTR_ERR(task);
00399 
00400                         CERROR("Failed to create thread for "
00401                                 "WI scheduler %s: %d\n", name, rc);
00402 
00403                         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00404 
00405                         /* make up for cfs_wi_sched_destroy */
00406                         list_add(&sched->ws_list, &cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds);
00407                         sched->ws_starting--;
00408 
00409                         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00410 
00411                         cfs_wi_sched_destroy(sched);
00412                         return rc;
00413                 }
00414         }
00415 
00416         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00417         list_add(&sched->ws_list, &cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds);
00418         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00419 
00420         *sched_pp = sched;
00421         return 0;
00422 }
00423 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_wi_sched_create);
00424 
00425 int
00426 cfs_wi_startup(void)
00427 {
00428         memset(&cfs_wi_data, 0, sizeof(struct cfs_workitem_data));
00429 
00430         spin_lock_init(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00431         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds);
00432         cfs_wi_data.wi_init = 1;
00433 
00434         return 0;
00435 }
00436 
00437 void
00438 cfs_wi_shutdown (void)
00439 {
00440         struct cfs_wi_sched     *sched;
00441 
00442         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00443         cfs_wi_data.wi_stopping = 1;
00444         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00445 
00446         /* nobody should contend on this list */
00447         list_for_each_entry(sched, &cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds, ws_list) {
00448                 sched->ws_stopping = 1;
00449                 wake_up_all(&sched->ws_waitq);
00450         }
00451 
00452         list_for_each_entry(sched, &cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds, ws_list) {
00453                 spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00454 
00455                 while (sched->ws_nthreads != 0) {
00456                         spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00457                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00458                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1) / 20);
00459                         spin_lock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00460                 }
00461                 spin_unlock(&cfs_wi_data.wi_glock);
00462         }
00463 
00464         while (!list_empty(&cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds)) {
00465                 sched = list_entry(cfs_wi_data.wi_scheds.next,
00466                                        struct cfs_wi_sched, ws_list);
00467                 list_del(&sched->ws_list);
00468                 LIBCFS_FREE(sched, sizeof(*sched));
00469         }
00470 
00471         cfs_wi_data.wi_stopping = 0;
00472         cfs_wi_data.wi_init = 0;
00473 }
